definition: Time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
to help each other out in hard times (idiom)
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
lit. sincerity splits open metal and metal (idiom); if you put your heart to it, you can break up metal and rocks/With a will, you can achieve anything.
pinyin: jing1 cheng2 suo3 jia1 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1

definition: see 一之為甚|一之为甚[yi1 zhi1 wei2 shen4]
don't let rhetoric spoil the message (idiom); don't get carried away with flowery speech to the detriment of what you want to say
sacrificing one's life generously (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
to attain a state of perfect governance (idiom)
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
